RegisterGroup.name: TIMER0_LOAD
RegisterGroup.description:
TIMERx_LOAD is the initial count value register. It is used to set the initial count value ofeach timer. Each timer (timer0–timer3) has one such register.NOTE
  • The minimum valid value written to TIMERx_LOAD is 1.
  • When the value 0 is written to TIMERx_LOAD, the dual-timer module generates an interruptimmediately.If values are written to TIMERx_BGLOAD and TIMERx_LOADbefore the rising edge ofTIMCLK enabled by TIMCLKENx reaches, the count value of the next rising edge ofTIMCLK is changed to the value written to TIMERx_LOAD. As the value ofafter TIMERx_BGLOAD is read is the latest value that is written to TIMERx_LOAD andTTIMERx_BGLOAD. When the timer works in periodic mode and the count value decreasesto 0, the initial value is loaded from TIMERx_BGLOAD to continue counting.Total Reset Value

Member.name: timer0_load
Member.description: Initial count value of timer0

RegisterGroup.name: TIMER0_VALUE
RegisterGroup.description:
TIMERx_VALUE is the current count value register. It shows the current value of the counterthat is decremented. Each timer (timer0–timer3) has one such register.After a value is written to TIMERx_LOAD, TIMERx_VALUE immediately shows the newlyloaded value of the counter in the PCLK domain without waiting for the clock edge ofTIMCLK enabled by TIMCLKENx.NOTE
When a timer is in 16-bit mode, the 16 upper bits of the 32-bit TIMERx_VALUE are not set to 0automatically. If the timer is switched from 32-bit mode to 16-bit mode and no data is written toOffset Address

Member.name: timer0_value
Member.description: Current count value of timer0 that is decremented.

RegisterGroup.name: TIMER0_CONTROL
RegisterGroup.description:
TIMERx_CONTROL is the control register. Each timer (timer0–timer3) has one such register.NOTE
When the periodic mode is selected, TIMERx_CONTROL[timermode] must be set to 1 andTIMERx_CONTROL[oneshot] must be set to 0.

Member.name: timeren
Member.description:
Timer enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: timermode
Member.description:
Timer count mode.
0: free-running mode
1: periodic mode

Member.name: intenable
Member.description:
Raw interrupt mask.
0: masked
1: not masked

Member.name: timerpre
Member.description:
Prescaling factor configuration.
00: no prescaling. That is, the clock frequency of the timer is divided by 1
01: 4-level prescaling. That is, the clock frequency of the timer is divided by 16
10: 8-level prescaling. That is, the clock frequency of the timer is divided by 256
11: undefined. If the bits are set to 11, 8-level prescaling is considered. That is, the clock frequency of the timer is divided by 256.

Member.name: timersize
Member.description:
Counter select.
0: 16-bit counter
1: 32-bit counter

RegisterGroup.name: TIMER0_INTCLR
RegisterGroup.description: TIMERx_INTCLR is the interrupt clear register. The interrupt status of a counter is clearedafter any operation is performed on this register. Each timer (timer0–timer3) has one suchregister.CAUTIONThis register is a write-only register. The timer clears interrupts when any value is written tothis register. In addition, no value is recorded in this register and no default reset value isdefined.

Member.name: timer0_intclr
Member.description: Writing this register clears the output interrupt of timer0.

RegisterGroup.name: TIMER0_RIS
RegisterGroup.description: TIMERx_RIS is the raw interrupt status register. Each timer (timer0–timer3) has one suchregister.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. Writing this register has no effect and reading this register returns 0.

RegisterGroup.name: TIMER0_MIS
RegisterGroup.description: TIMERx_MIS is the masked interrupt status register. Each timer (timer0–timer3) has onesuch register.

RegisterGroup.name: TIMER0_BGLOAD
RegisterGroup.description: TIMERx_BGLOAD is the initial count value register in periodic mode. Each timer(timer0–timer3) has one such register.The TIMERx_BGLOAD register contains the initial count value of the timer. This register isused to reload an initial count value when the count value of the timer reaches 0 in periodicmode.In addition, this register provides another method of accessing TIMERx_LOAD. Thedifference is that after a value is written to TIMERx_BGLOAD, the timer does not countstarting from the input value immediately.

Member.name: timer0bgload
Member.description:
Initial count value of timer0.
Note: This register differs from TIMERx_LOAD. For details, see the descriptions of TIMERx_LOAD.

RegisterGroup.name: WDG_LOAD
RegisterGroup.description: WDG_LOAD is an initial count value register. It is used to configure the initial count value ofthe internal counter of the watchdog.

Member.name: wdg_load
Member.description: Initial count value of the watchdog counter.

RegisterGroup.name: WDG_VALUE
RegisterGroup.description: WDG_VALUE is a current count value register It is used to read the current count value ofthe internal counter of the watchdog.

Member.name: wdogvalue
Member.description: Current count value of the watchdog counter.

RegisterGroup.name: WDG_CONTROL
RegisterGroup.description: WDG_CONTROL is a control register. It is used to enable or disable the watchdog andcontrol the interrupt and reset functions of the watchdog.

Member.name: resen
Member.description:
Output enable of the watchdog reset signal.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: inten
Member.description:
Output enable of the watchdog interrupt signal.
0: The counter stops counting, the current count value remains unchanged, and the watchdog is disabled.
1: The counter, interrupt and watchdog are enabled.

RegisterGroup.name: WDG_INTCLR
RegisterGroup.description: WDG_INTCLR is an interrupt clear register. It is used to clear watchdog interrupts so thewatchdog can reload an initial value for counting. This register is write-only. When a value iswritten to this register, the watchdog interrupts are cleared. No written value is recorded inthis register and no default reset value is defined.

Member.name: wdg_intclr
Member.description: Writing any value to this register clears the watchdog interrupts and enables the watchdog to reload an initial count value from WDG_LOAD to restart counting.

RegisterGroup.name: WDG_RIS
RegisterGroup.description: WDG_RIS is a raw interrupt status register. It shows the raw interrupt status of the watchdog.

Member.name: wdogris
Member.description:
Status of the raw interrupts of the watchdog. When the count value reaches 0, this bit is set to 1.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

RegisterGroup.name: WDG_MIS
RegisterGroup.description: WDG_MIS is a masked interrupt status register. It shows the masked interrupt status of thewatchdog.

Member.name: wdogmis
Member.description:
Status of the masked interrupts of the watchdog.
0: No interrupt is generated or the interrupt is masked.
1: An interrupt is generated.

RegisterGroup.name: WDG_LOCK
RegisterGroup.description: WDG_LOCK is a lock register. It is used to control the write and read permissions for thewatchdog registers.

Member.name: wdg_lock
Member.description:
Writing 0x1ACC_E551 to this register enables the write permission for all the registers.
Writing other values disables the write permission for all the registers.
When this register is read, the lock status rather than the written value of this register is returned.
0x0000_0000: The write permission is available (unlocked).
0x0000_0001: The write permission is unavailable (locked).

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_STATUS
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_STATUS is a DDRC status register.

Member.name: in_init
Member.description:
Initialization status of a controller.
0: normal
1: initializing

Member.name: in_sr
Member.description:
Self-refresh status of a controller.
0: normal
1: self refreshing

Member.name: busy
Member.description:
Busy status of a controller.
0: idle
1: A command is being processed.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_SREFCTRL
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_SREFCTRL is a DDRC self-refresh control register.

Member.name: sr_req
Member.description:
SDRAM self-refresh request.
0: exit the self-refresh status
1: enter the self-refresh status

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_INITCTRL
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_INITCTRL is a DDRC initialization control register.

Member.name: init_req
Member.description:
Initialization enable.
0: Initialization is complete or initialization is performed properly.
1: The SDRAM starts to be initialized.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_CTRL
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_CTRL is a DDRC control register.

Member.name: ddr_rst_n
Member.description:
DDR3 SDRAM reset.
0: valid
1: invalid
Note: This bit is valid only for the DDR3 SDRAM and is set to 1 by default.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_EMRS01
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_EMRS01 is a DDR mode configuration register.

Member.name: emrs1
Member.description: DDRn SDRAM extended mode register 1.

Member.name: mrs
Member.description: DDRn SDRAM mode register.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_EMRS23
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_EMRS23 is a DDR extended mode configuration register.

Member.name: emrs3
Member.description: DDRn SDRAM extended mode register 3.

Member.name: emrs2
Member.description: DDRn SDRAM extended mode register 2.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_CONFIG0
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_CONFIG0 is DDRC function configuration register 0.

Member.name: init_arefnum
Member.description:
Number of auto-refresh operations when the DDRn SDRAM is being initialized.
0x0–0x2: two
0x3–0xF: n.

Member.name: pd_prd
Member.description:
Power down cycle of the SDRAM. When the DDRC does not receive any command in pd_prd consecutive cycles, it forces the DDRn SDRAM to enter the low-power mode; when a command is received, the DDRC forces the DDRn SDRAM to exit the low-power mode.
0x00: 1 clock cycle
0x01–0xFF: n clock cycles
Note: This parameter is valid only when pd_en is 1.

Member.name: rcv_pdr
Member.description:
DDR receive I/O dynamic power-down control enable. The DDRC disables the receive buffer of the DDR data I/O in the non-read status when it is enabled.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: sr_cc
Member.description:
DDRn SDRAM clock control in self-refresh mode.
0: The DDRn SDRAM clock is enabled.
1: The DDRn SDRAM clock is disabled.

Member.name: pd_cc
Member.description:
DDRn SDRAM clock control in power-down mode.
0: The DDRn SDRAM clock is enabled.
1: The DDRn SDRAM clock is disabled.
Note: This parameter is valid only when the LPDDR SDRAM or LPDDR2 SDRAM is connected.

Member.name: pd_en
Member.description:
Automatic low-power enable of the DDRn SDRAM.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: rank
Member.description:
Rank configuration of the DDRC.
00: 1 rank
Other values: reserved

Member.name: dram_type
Member.description:
External memory type.
101: DDR2
110: DDR3
Other values: reserved

Member.name: mem_width
Member.description:
Bit width of the storage data bus.
00: 16 bits
01: 32 bits
Other values: reserved

Member.name: brst_a12
Member.description:
DDR3 SDRAM A12 command enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: The recommended value is 0.

Member.name: brstlen
Member.description:
Burst length of the DDRC.
0: burst4
1: burst8
When the ratio of the frequency of the DDRC to the frequency of the PHY is 1:1, the burst length of the DDR2 SDRAM can be set to burst 4 or burst 8. The burst length of the DDR3 SDRAM can only be set to burst 8.
When the ratio of the frequency of the DDRC to the frequency of the PHY is 1:2, the burst length of the DDR2 SDRAM and the DDR3 SDRAM can only be set to burst 4

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_CONFIG1
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_CONFIG1 is DDRC function configuration register 1.

Member.name: sref_arefnum
Member.description:
Number of times of auto refresh operations after DDRn SDRAM exits auto refresh in DFS process.
0x0–0x1: once
0x2–0xF: n times
Note: This field is valid only when train_en is 1. When train_en is 0, DDRn SDRAM exits self refresh and DDRC does not perform auto refresh operation.

Member.name: sref_zqc_en
Member.description:
ZQ calibration long enable when the DDR exits the self-refresh state.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: This bit is valid for the DDR3 or LPDDR2 mode.If the DDR is in the self-refresh state for a long time, set this bit to 1.

Member.name: clk_switch
Member.description:
DDRC low-power clock switch control. This field determines whether to perform back pressure on AXI port command when DDRC enters the low-power status (DDR self refresh).
0: not perform back pressure on the command and return the error response.
1: perform back pressure on the command and run the original command when the clock is switched.

Member.name: odis_ddrio
Member.description:
Output disable configuration of the DDR command and data I/O.
0: enable the pin output
1: disable the pin output
Note: This is a static configuration. When DDR enters the self–refresh mode, set DDR to 1 to disable the DDR command and data I/O output. Before DDR exits the self–refresh mode, set DDR to 0 to enable the DDR command and data I/O output.

Member.name: pd_ac
Member.description:
SDRAM address command status enable control in power-down mode.
0: enable the pin output
1: disable the pin output
Note: When pd_en is enabled, pd_ac is valid. The control pins exclude CKE, ODT, CSN, and RESET_N.

Member.name: pd_pst_opn
Member.description:
SDRAM address/command pin delay before the power-down mode is exited.
00: 0 cycles
01: 1 cycle
10: 2 cycles
11: 3cycles
Note: When pd_en is enabled, pd_pst_opn is valid. The control pins exclude CKE and RESET_N.

Member.name: pd_pre_cls
Member.description:
SDRAM address/command disable delay after the power-down mode is entered.
00: 0 cycles
01: 1 cycle
10: 2 cycles
11: 3 cycles
Note: When pd_en is enabled, pd_pre_cls is valid. The control pins exclude CKE and RESET_N.

Member.name: auto_pre_en
Member.description:
Auto precharge enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: wr_rcv_mode
Member.description:
Mode of receiving the write command over the DDRC AXI port.
0: The write command is received directly.
1: The write command is received only after the expected data to be written arrives.

Member.name: exclu_en
Member.description:
Exclusive command enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: lock_en
Member.description:
WRAP command lock enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: aref_mode
Member.description:
Auto-refresh mode select.
0: An auto-refresh operation is performed every one tREFI period.
1: Eight auto-refresh operations are performed every nine tREFI periods.

Member.name: wrlvl_en
Member.description:
Auto-control enable of the DDR3 write level hardware.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: reserved
Member.description:
Reserved.
This field must be set to 0.

Member.name: read_mode
Member.description:
Read mode select of the DDRC.
0: associated read mode
1: delay read mode
The associated read mode is a mode in which the DDRC samples data based on the data valid signal from the PHY.
The delay read mode is a mode in which the DDRC samples the data from the PHY after the internal delay of the DDRC.
Note: This bit must be set to 0 when DDRC_DTRCTRL[train_mode] is set to 0.

Member.name: clkratio
Member.description:
Operating mode of the DDRC.
When the frequency ratio of DDRC to PHY is 1:1, this bit is set to 0.
When the frequency ratio of DDRC to PHY is 1:2, this bit is set to 1.

Member.name: ecc_en
Member.description:
ECC enable of the DDRC
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: zqc_en
Member.description:
DDR3 SDRAM ZQ enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: This bit is valid for the DDR3 SDRAM only and is set to 1 by default.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_CMDCFG
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_CMDCFG is a DDRC command configuration register.

Member.name: cmd_mrs
Member.description: Value of the DDR mode register when the load mode register (LMR) command is configured.

Member.name: cmd_ba
Member.description: Value of the DDR BA when the LMR command is configured.

Member.name: cmd_rank
Member.description:
Rank for running commands.
0: The configuration command is executed.
1: The configuration command is not executed.
Each bit controls a rank.
Note: As the Hi3518 only has rank0, cmd_rank must be set to 0x0 or 0x1.

Member.name: cmd_type
Member.description:
DDR command configuration.
00: enter the deep power-down mode
01: exit the deep power-down mode
10: LMR command
11: ZQCL

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_CMDEXE
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_CMDEXE is a DDRC software configuration command start register.

Member.name: cmd_req
Member.description:
Request of executing the configuration command of the DDRC.
0: The command is not executed or the parameter is cleared automatically after the command is executed.
1: The command is requested to be executed.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_RNKCFG
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_RNKCFG is a DDR feature configuration register.

Member.name: mem_map
Member.description:
Address translation mode of the SDRAM.
00: {Rank, Row, Ba, Col, DW} = AXI_Address
01: {Rank, Ba, Row, Col, DW} = AXI_Address
Other values: reserved

Member.name: mem_bank
Member.description:
Number of banks of a single SDRAM.
0: 4 banks
1: 8 banks
If there are multiple ranks, the ranks in the same channel can have different configurations. In dual-channel mode, the dual channels must have the same configuration.

Member.name: mem_row
Member.description:
Bit width of the row address of a single SDRAM.
000: 11 bits
001: 12 bits
010: 13 bits
011: 14 bits
100: 15 bits
101: 16 bits
Other values: reserved

Member.name: mem_col
Member.description:
Bit width of the column address of a single SDRAM.
000: 8 bits
001: 9 bits
010: 10 bits
011: 11 bits
100: 12 bits
Other values: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_BASEADDR
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_BASEADDR is a DDR space base address configuration register.

Member.name: mem_base_addr
Member.description: Configuration of the start base address of the DDR in the system.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TIMING0
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TIMING0 is DDR timing parameter register 0.

Member.name: tmrd
Member.description:
Count of wait cycles of LMR command.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles

Member.name: trrd
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles of the ACT bank A to ACT bank B command.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles

Member.name: trp
Member.description:
Count of wait cycles for disabling commands (PRE period).
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles

Member.name: trcd
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles from the ACT bank command to the read or write bank command.
0x0–0x3: 3 clock cycles
0x4–0xF: n clock cycles

Member.name: trc
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles from an ACT bank command to the next ACT bank command.
0x00–0x01: 1 clock cycle
0x02–0x3F: n clock cycles

Member.name: tras
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles from ACT to PRE.
0x00–0x01: 1 clock cycle
0x02–0x0F: n clock cycles

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TIMING1
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TIMING1 is DDR timing parameter register 1.

Member.name: tsre
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles from the self-refresh exit command to the read command.
0x0: 1 clock cycle
0x01–0xFF: n x 2 clock cycles
When the DDR3 SDRAM is used, the value is set to tXSDLL.

Member.name: trdlat
Member.description:
Inherent delay of the DDR PHY.
0x0–0xF: n + 1 clock cycles
When the Dophin PHY is used, the value is set to 0x5.
This field is valid when read_mode is 1 (delay read mode).

Member.name: trtw
Member.description:
Delay from the last read data segment to the first written data segment.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2-0xF: n + 1 clock cycles

Member.name: twl
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles from the write command to the write data.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles
For example, 0x3 indicates 3 clock cycles.
Note: In DDR2 mode, tw1 is set to (tcl – 1) and the equation of twl – taond ≥ 1 must be true.
Note: The time parameter value is calculated based on the DDR SRAM clock cycle.

Member.name: tcl
Member.description:
DDR CL from the read command to the read data.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles
Note: The time parameter value is calculated based on the DDR SRAM clock cycle.

Member.name: trfc
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles of the AREF period or AREF to the ACT command. The register can be set to the maximum value max{trfc, tzqcs}.
0x00–0x01: 1 clock cycle
0x02–0xFF: n clock cycles

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TIMING2
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TIMING2 is DDR timing parameter register 2.

Member.name: tcke
Member.description:
Minimum cycle of maintaining the low-power mode.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles
The value needs to be set to the maximum value among tCKESR, tCKSRE, tCKSRX, and tCKE.
When the Dophin DDR PHY is used, the value of this register needs to be set to max{tCKSRx, tCKE} + 3.

Member.name: twtr
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles of the last write-to-read command.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles
For example, 0x3 indicates 3 clock cycles.

Member.name: twr
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles of write recovery.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles
Note: When DFS is required, tWR must be set to the maximum frequency in the DFS and cannot be changed with the frequency of the DDR.

Member.name: tfaw
Member.description:
Number of clock cycles of four consecutive activation commands.
0x00-0x3F: n clock cycles
For example, 0x14 indicates 20 clock cycles.

Member.name: taref
Member.description:
Number of auto-refresh cycles.
0x000: forbidden
0x001–0x7FF: The auto-refresh cycle of the SDRAM is 16 x n clock cycles.
For example, 0x008 indicates 128 clock cycles.
The configuration interval is calculated as follows: Configuration interval = tREFI/16/Tclk. tREFI is 7800 ns, and Tclk is two times of the running cycle when the SDRAM is used.
When DDRC_CONFIG1[aref_mode] is 1, the interval of DDRC_TIMING2 must be set to 8 x tREFI.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TIMING3
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TIMING3 is DDR timing parameter register 3.

Member.name: tzq_prd
Member.description:
Number of ZQCS command cycles.
0x000: The ZQCS command is forbidden.
0x001–0x3FF: n x 128 AREF cycles.
The number of ZQCS command cycles is n x 128 taref clock cycles.

Member.name: tzqinit
Member.description:
Number of delay cycles during ZQ initialization.
0x0–0x1FF: n + 1 clock cycles
The value needs to be set to the maximum value between tZQINIT and tDLLK.

Member.name: taond
Member.description:
Count of ODT enable/disable cycles.
In DDR2 mode (taond/taofd):
0x0: 2/2.5
0x1: 3/3.5
0x2: 4/4.5
0x3: 5/5.5
Other values: reserved
In DDR3 mode, the value is set to (tWL – 1).
Note: The time parameter value is calculated based on the DDR SRAM clock cycle.

Member.name: txard
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles of exiting the DDR low-power mode.
0x0–0xF: n clock cycles. The letter n indicates the corresponding decimal value.
For example, 0x7 indicates 7 clock cycles.
The value is set to the maximum value among tXP, tXARD, tXARDS, and tXS.
In DDR3 mode, when the register is set to tXS, txard only needs to be set to an equivalent clock cycle of 10 ns.

Member.name: trtp
Member.description:
Wait delay from the read command to the disable command.
000–010: 2 clock cycles
011–111: n clock cycles
Trtp is calculated as follows: AL + BL/2 + Max(trtp, 2) – 2

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TIMING4
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TIMING4 is DDR timing parameter register 4.

Member.name: twlo
Member.description:
DDR3 write level status delay.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles
The parameter is equal to twlo+twloe defined in the DDR3 protocol.

Member.name: twldqsen
Member.description:
DDR3 write level start delay.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x02-0x3F: n clock cycles

Member.name: twlmrd
Member.description:
Valid delay of the initial DQS of DDR3 write level.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x02-0x3F: n clock cycles

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_DTRADDR
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_DTRADDR is a DDRC gating training address configuration register.

Member.name: train_row
Member.description: Row address of the DDRn SDRAM used in the gating position training. When the row address is less than 16 bits, the upper bits are stuffed with 0s.

Member.name: train_bank
Member.description: Bank address of the DDRn SDRAM used in the gating position training. When the bank address is less than three bits, the upper bits are stuffed with 0s.

Member.name: train_col
Member.description: Column address of the DDRn SDRAM used in the gating position training. When the column address is less than 13 bits, the upper bits are stuffed with 0s.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_DTRDATA0
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_DTRDATA0 is DDRC gating training data configuration register 0.

Member.name: dtr_byte3
Member.description:
Gating training data configuration 0 of the DDRC.
When the DDRC performs training, data must be transferred in DDR BL8 mode in each read or write operation.
Note: The data configured for each byte (data for the upper four bits and lower four bits) must be different.

Member.name: dtr_byte2
Member.description: Gating training data configuration of the DDRC.

Member.name: dtr_byte1
Member.description: Gating training data configuration of the DDRC.

Member.name: dtr_byte0
Member.description: Gating training data configuration of the DDRC.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_DTRDATA1
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_DTRDATA1 is DDRC gating training data configuration register 1.

Member.name: dtr_byte7
Member.description:
Gating training data configuration 1 of the DDRC.
When the DDRC performs training, data must be transferred in DDR BL8 mode in each read or write operation.
Note: The data configured for each byte (data for the upper four bits and lower four bits) must be different.

Member.name: dtr_byte6
Member.description: Gating training data configuration of the DDRC.

Member.name: dtr_byte5
Member.description: Gating training data configuration of the DDRC.

Member.name: dtr_byte4
Member.description: Gating training data configuration of the DDRC.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_DTRCTRL
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_DTRCTRL is a DDRC gating training control register.

Member.name: dt_byte
Member.description:
Byte training enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
[24]: DDRC byte0 training enable
…
[31]: DDRC byte7 training enable

Member.name: train_start_pos
Member.description:
Start position of the gating training.
0x0-0x5: n clock cycles
Other values: reserved

Member.name: train_rank
Member.description:
Number of ranks in the gating training.
0x0–0x3: n + 1 ranks
Note: As the Hi3518 has only one rank, train_rank can be set only to 0.

Member.name: rensel
Member.description:
Read enable delay cycle.
000–011: n + 1 clock cycles
Other values: reserved

Member.name: train_mode
Member.description:
Gating training mode.
0: Dophin training mode
1: common training mode

Member.name: dt_limit
Member.description:
DQS gating shift control.
00: shift 0°
01: shift 90°
10: shift 180°
11: shift 270°

Member.name: track_en
Member.description:
Auto-refresh enable for the gating position.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: A read operation is required between two training operations and the continuous length of the accessed data must be greater than DDR burst 8.

Member.name: train_en
Member.description:
Gating position training enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_DTRPRD
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_DTRPRD is a DDRC gating track period configuration register.

Member.name: track_prd
Member.description:
Auto-update period configuration of the DQS gating. The DDRC tracks the gating position in the configured period.
0x0: 1 AREF period
0x1–0x7FF: n + 1 AREF periods

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_DTRGATE
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_DTRGATE is a DDRC gating phase position register.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description:
Reserved.
Note: This register cannot be read continuously.

Member.name: gate_sel
Member.description:
Gating phase position of the DDRC.
00: 0°
01: 90°
10: 180°
11: 270°
[2 x (N + 1) – 1:2 x N]: gating phase of DDRC byteN
N = 0–7

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_DTRLAT
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_DTRLAT is a DDRC gating period position register.

Member.name: sys_lat
Member.description:
Number of gating delay cycles of the DDRC.
0x0–0x5: n clock cycles
Other values: reserved
[4 x (N + 1) – 1:4 x N]: gating phase of DDRC ByteN.
N = 0–7
Note: This register cannot be read or written continuously.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_DTRSTATUS
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_DTRSTATUS is a DDRC gating status register.

Member.name: dtr_st
Member.description:
Phase shift status of the byte gating position.
00: shift 0°
01: shift 90°
10: shift 180°
11: shift 270°
bit[31:30] to bit[17:16]: Each two bits correspond to DDRC byte7 to DDRC byte0 respectively.

Member.name: dtr_ok
Member.description:
Gating training status.
0: training error
1: no training error
bit[15] to bit[8]: Each bit corresponds to DDRC byte7 to DDRC byte0 respectively.

Member.name: dtr_err
Member.description:
Auto tracking error status of the gating position.
0: no tracking error
1: tracking error
bit[7] to bit[0]: Each bit corresponds to DDRC byte7 to DDRC byte0 respectively.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_AXISTATUS

1: A command is being executed.

0: idle
1: A command is being executed.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_ODTCFG

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. This field must be fixed at 0.

Member.name: rodt0
Member.description:
Read ODT configuration of rank0.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. This field must be fixed at 0.

Member.name: wodt0
Member.description:
Write ODT configuration of rank1.
0: disabled
1: enabled

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_QOSCFG0
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_QOSCFG0 is DDRC QoS algorithm configuration register 0.

Member.name: idmap_mode
Member.description:
ID mapping mode.
0: The id_map mapping mode configured by the register is used by default.
1: The QoS mapping mode is used. The AXI port configures this mode in associated mode by running read/write commands. This mapping mode is valid only when its macro definition is enabled in the RTL code.

Member.name: id_order_ctl
Member.description:
Out-of –order execution enable of the specified ID.
0: disabled
1: enabled The DDRC does not ensure the order when conflict occurs between the DDR row addresses of the read/write commands with the specified ID and other IDs. Master ensures the consistency of the data.

Member.name: order_en
Member.description:
Execution order enable for the commands with the same priority.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: dmc_fifo_lvl
Member.description:
Depth of the command register FIFO in the DMC.
0x0–0xF: n + 1 command depths
Note: The maximum depth of the command register FIFO in the Hi3518 is 0xB, but it is recommended to set the depth to 0x7.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_QOSCFG1
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_QOSCFG1 is DDRC QoS algorithm configuration register 1.

Member.name: id_map_rd
Member.description:
For the read command, four bits are selected to configure the QoS based on the read IDs of the bus.
Bit[15:12]: configure bit[3] mapping to the ID
Bit[11:8]: configure bit[2] mapping to the ID
Bit[7:4]: configure bit[1] mapping to the ID
Bit[3:0]: configure bit[0] mapping to the ID
For example, if ID_MAP is set to 0x5320, the bus IDs ID[5], ID[3], ID[2], and ID[0] are used for ID mapping and priority configuration.
The DDRC inserts 3-bit IDs between the ninth bit, eighth bit and seventh bit of the existing 13-bit ID. These three bits indicate the AXI port numbers. Therefore, the bit width of the ID mapped by the DDRC is 16 bits.
000: AXI port 0
001: AXI port 1
010: AXI port 2
011: AXI port 3
100: AXI port 4
101: AXI port 5
110: AXI port 6
111: AXI port 7

Member.name: id_map_wr
Member.description:
For the write command, four bits are selected to configure the DQS based on the write IDs of the bus.
Bit[15:12]: configure bit[3] mapping to the ID
Bit[11:8]: configure bit[2] mapping to the ID
Bit[7:4]: configure bit[1] mapping to the ID
Bit[3:0]: configure bit[0] mapping to the ID
For example, if ID_MAP is set to 0x5320, the bus IDs ID[5], ID[3], ID[2], and ID[0] are used for ID mapping and priority configuration.
The DDRC inserts 3-bit IDs between the ninth bit, eighth bit and seventh bit of the existing 13-bit ID. These three bits indicate the AXI port numbers. Therefore, the bit width of the ID mapped by the DDRC is 16 bits.
000: AXI port 0
001: AXI port 1
010: AXI port 2
011: AXI port 3
100: AXI port 4
101: AXI port 5
110: AXI port 6
111: AXI port 7

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_QOS
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_QOS is a DDRC read command priority configuration register.

Member.name: pri_apt
Member.description:
Read command priority adaptation configuration.
0x0: disabled
0x1?0xF: n x 16 clock cycles

Member.name: age_prd
Member.description:
Read command aging cycle configuration.
0x0: disabled
0x1?0xF: n x 16 clock cycles

Member.name: qos_en
Member.description:
Read command QoS enable (timeout).
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: qos
Member.description:
Read command QoS configuration (timeout).
0x1?0x3FF: n clock cycles
Other values: reserved
Note: The used timeout is an integral multiple of 16. The lower four bits of rd_qos is ignored.

Member.name: pri
Member.description:
Read command priority configuration.
000: highest priority
001: higher priority
…
111: lowest priority

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_FLUX
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_FLUX is a DDRC AXI port bandwidth traffic control configuration register.

Member.name: flux_port_en
Member.description:
AXI port DDRC traffic count enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: flux_ovfl
Member.description:
AXI port traffic overflow allow enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
When this bit is set to 1, the traffic of the AXI port exceeds the bandwidth limit, and no request is raised over the AXI ports without overflow, the bandwidth of the AXI port can exceed the configured value.

Member.name: flux_lvl
Member.description:
AXI port traffic overflow allow threshold.
0x0–0xC: DMC threshold for allowing traffic overflow
Other values: reserved
When flux_ovfl is set to 1, this traffic overflow over the AXI port is allowed if the traffic of the AXI port is greater than the configured bandwidth of flux and the number of the commands to be processed in DMC is less than the configured threshold.

Member.name: flux
Member.description:
Bandwidth configuration of the AXI port.
0x0–0x3FF: ratio of the maximum DDR bandwidth to the total bandwidth accessed by the AXI port. The total bandwidth is 1024. The configured value is calculated as follows: ratio of the required bandwidth to the total bandwidth x1024. For example, if 20% of bandwidth is required for this AXI port, configure flux to 0xCD.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TEST0
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TEST0 is a DDRC test status register.

Member.name: dmc_ct
Member.description: DDRC command type.

Member.name: dmc_cv
Member.description: Commands that are being processed by the DDRC.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TEST1
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TEST1 is a DDRC test status register.

Member.name: dt_num
Member.description: Cycle n select, data read from the training module (n = 0–23).

Member.name: byte_sel
Member.description:
Channel select of the returned data.
0x0–0x7: channel n select

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TEST2
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TEST2 is a DDRC test status register.

Member.name: data_h
Member.description: Upper 32 bits of the training data.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TEST3
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TEST3 is a DDRC test status register.

Member.name: data_l
Member.description: Lower 32 bits of the training data.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TEST4
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TEST4 is a DDRC test status register.

Member.name: dt_ok_cnt
Member.description:
Number of times of correct training data.
0x0–0xF: n + 1
[3 x (N + 1) – 1:3 x N]: number of times of correct byteN

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TEST7
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TEST7 is a DDRC performance measurement control register.

Member.name: perf_mode
Member.description:
Performance measurement mode.
0: continuous trigger mode. The performance counter counts continuously. No data overflow occurs within 1s = (533 MHz).
1: single trigger mode. When the performance counter reaches the maximum value, the count value is retained but counting is stopped.
Note: When an overflow occurs, the count values wrap.

Member.name: perf_en
Member.description:
Performance measurement enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: When perf_mode is 0 and this bit is enabled, performance measurement register starts cyclic counting. When perf_mode is 1, this bit is cleared after counting is complete once.

Member.name: perf_ch
Member.description:
Read and write count channel.
00: disabled
01: channel 0
10: channel 1
11: channel 0 and channel 1
Note: This register limits the number of read/write command count channels of DDRC_TEST8 and DDRC_TEST9.

Member.name: perf_prd
Member.description:
Performance measurement cycle.
0x0–0xFFFFFFF: count cycles
The actual count cycle is calculated as follows: perf_prd x 4 xtclk. Where tclk is the bus clock cycle of the DDRC.
Note: This configuration is valid only when perf_mode is 1. When perf_mode is set to 0 to select the continuous count mode, the performance counters keep on counting.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TEST8
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TEST8 is a DDRC write command count register.

Member.name: wr_num
Member.description:
Count of write commands in the count period. This register is written to clear.
Wrap cycle counting is supported.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TEST9
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TEST9 is a DDRC read command count register.

Member.name: rd_num
Member.description:
Count of read commands in the count period. This register is written to clear.
Wrap cycle counting is supported.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TEST10
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TEST10 is a DDRC DMC wait command count register.

Member.name: dmc_cmd_num
Member.description:
Count of DMC wait commands of the DDRC in the count period. This register is written to clear.
Wrap cycle counting is supported.
Note: As the register width is limited and data overflow needs to be avoided within 1s under the 533 MHz clock, the displayed count value of this register is the actual count value divided by 2.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TEST12
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TEST12 is a DDRC test status register.

Member.name: wfifo_f
Member.description: Write FIFO full status.

Member.name: wfifo_e
Member.description:
Write FIFO empty status.
Note: Only the 12-bit reset value is 0xFFF for the Hi3518.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TEST13
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TEST13 is DDRC reorder test status register 1.

Member.name: ddrexec_reorder
Member.description: DDREXEC reorder status.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TEST14
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TEST14 is DDRC reorder test status register 2.

Member.name: ddrexec_reorder_req
Member.description: DDREXEC reorder request status.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TEST15
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TEST15 is DDRC reorder test status register 3.

Member.name: ddrexec_reorder_gnt
Member.description: DDREXEC reorder arbitration status.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_PUB_PIR
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_PUB_PIR is a PHY initialization register.

Member.name: initbyp
Member.description:
Initialization bypass.
If this bit is set, all running initialization routines including PHY initialization, DRAM initialization, and PHY training are bypassed or stopped. Initialization may be manually triggered by using INIT and the other relevant bits of the PIR register. This bit is self-cleared.

Member.name: zcalbyp
Member.description:
Impedance calibration bypass.
If this bit is set, impedance calibration of all ZQ control blocks that are automatically triggered after reset are bypassed or stopped. Impedance calibration may be manually triggered by using INIT and ZCAL bits of the PIR register. This bit is self-cleared.

Member.name: lockbyp
Member.description:
DLL lock bypass.
If this bit is set, the waiting of DLLs to lock is bypassed or stopped. DLL lock wait is automatically triggered after reset. DLL lock wait may be manually triggered by using INIT and DLLLOCK bits of the PIR register. This bit is self-cleared.

Member.name: clrsr
Member.description:
Status clear.
A write of '1' to this bit will clear (reset to '0') all status registers, including PGSR and DXnGSR. The clear status register bit is self-cleared.
This bit is primarily for debugging and is typically not needed during normal functional operation. When PGSR.IDONE is 1, it can be used to manually clear the PGSR status bits, although starting a new initialization process will automatically clear the PGSR status bits. It can also be used to manually clear the DXnGSR status bits, although starting a new data training process will automatically clear the DXnGSR status bits.

Member.name: ctldinit
Member.description:
Controller DRAM initialization.
If this bit is set, this DRAM initialization will be performed by the controller. If this bit is not set, this DRAM initialization will be performed by using the built-in initialization sequence or by using software over the configuration port.

Member.name: dllbyp
Member.description:
DLL bypass.
If this bit is set to 1, all PHY DLLs enter the bypass mode. A bypassed DLL is also powered down (disabled).

Member.name: icpc
Member.description:
Initialization complete pin configuration.
0: This bit is asserted after PHY initialization (DLL locking and impedance calibration) is complete.
1: This bit is asserted after PHY initialization and the triggered PUB initialization (DRAM initialization, data training, or initialization trigger with no selected initialization) are complete.

Member.name: eyetrn
Member.description:
Execute read data eye training by PUB.
0: disabled
1: enabled
This function is not support by this version.

Member.name: qstrn
Member.description:
Execute read DQS training by PUB.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: draminit
Member.description:
DRAM initialization for executing the DRAM initialization sequence.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: dramrst
Member.description:
DRAM reset (valid only for DDR3).
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: itmsrst
Member.description:
ITM soft reset.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: zcal
Member.description:
PHY impedance calibration.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: dlllock
Member.description:
DLL lock for waiting for the PHY DLLs to lock.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: dllsrst
Member.description:
DLL soft reset.
All PHY DLLs are soft-reset by driving the DLL soft reset pin.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: init
Member.description:
Initialization trigger (self-cleared).
0: No operation is performed.
1: The DDR system initialization is triggered.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_PUB_PGCR
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_PUB_PGCR is a PHY general configuration register.

Member.name: lbmode
Member.description:
Loopback mode.
If this bit is set, the PHY/PUB is in loopback mode.

Member.name: lbgdqs
Member.description:
Loopback DQS gating.
This bit is used to select the DQS gating mode (including BIST loopback mode) that should be used when the PHY is in loopback mode.
0: DQS gate training will be triggered on the PUB.
1: DQS gate is manually set by using software.

Member.name: lbdqss
Member.description:
Loopback DQS shift.
This bit is used to select how the read DQS is shifted during loopback to ensure that the read DQS is centered into the read data eye.
0: PUB sets the read DQS delay to 0, and the DQS is already shifted 90? by a write path.
1: The read DQS shift is manually set by using software.

Member.name: rfshdt
Member.description:
Refresh during training.
A non-zero value specifies that a burst of refreshes equal to the number specified in this field should be sent to the SDRAM after training of each rank except the last rank.

Member.name: pddisdx
Member.description:
Power down disabled byte.
If this bit is set, the DLL and I/Os of a disabled byte should be powered down.

Member.name: zcksel
Member.description:
Impedance clock divider select.
This bit is used to select the divide ratio for the clock used by the impedance control logic relative to the clock used by the memory controller and SDRAM.
00: divide by 2
01: divide by 8
10: divide by 32
11: divide by 64

Member.name: ranken
Member.description:
Rank enable.
This field specifies the ranks that are enabled for data training. Bit 0 controls rank 0, bit 1 controls rank 1, bit 2 controls rank 2, and bit 3 controls rank 3. Setting a bit to 1 enables the corresponding rank, and setting a bit to 0 disables the corresponding rank.
Note: The actual reset value is calculated based on the configured number of ranks. The Hi3518 supports only one rank.

Member.name: ioddrm
Member.description:
I/O DDR mode (D3F I/O only).
This field is used to select the DDR mode for the I/Os.

Member.name: iolb
Member.description:
I/O loopback select.
This bit is used to select where the signal loopback occurs inside the I/O.
0: Loopback is after output buffer, and output enable must be asserted
1: Loopback is before output buffer, and output enable is ignored.

Member.name: ckinv
Member.description:
CK invert.
If this bit is set, CK/CK# must be inverted. Otherwise, CK/CK# toggles with normal polarity.

Member.name: ckdv
Member.description:
CK disable value.
The static value that must be driven on CK/CK# pair(s) when the pair(s) is disabled. CKDV[0] specifies the value for CK and CKDV[1] specifies the value for CK#.

Member.name: cken
Member.description:
CK enable.
This field controls whether the CK going to the SDRAM is enabled (toggling) or disabled (static value defined by CKDV). One bit corresponds to each of the three CK pairs.

Member.name: dtosel
Member.description:
DLL test signal output select.
0000: test signal of DX DLL0
0001: test signal of DX DLL1
0010: test signal of DX DLL2
0011: test signal of DX DLL3
1001: test signal of the AC DLL
1111: test signal of DDR PHYB
Other values: reserved

Member.name: dftlmt
Member.description:
DQS drift limit.
This field specifies the expected limit of drift on read data strobes. A drift of this value or greater is reported as a drift error through the host port error flag.
00: no limit (no error is reported)
01: 90° drift
10: 180° drift
11: 270° or more drift
Note: Although a value is reported through the error flag, this is not an error and no action is required. It only indicates that the drift is greater than expected value.

Member.name: dftcmp
Member.description:
DQS drift compensation enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Drift compensation is enabled by default.
Note: Drift compensation must be disabled for LPDDR2.

Member.name: dqscfg
Member.description:
DQS gating configuration.
This bit is used to select one of the two DQS gating schemes.
0: DQS gating is shut off by using the rising edge of DQS_b (active window mode)
1: DQS gating blankets the whole burst (passive window mode).
Note: Passive window must be used for LPDDR2.

Member.name: itmdmd
Member.description:
ITM DDR mode.
This bit is used to select whether ITMS uses DQS and DQS# or it only uses DQS.
0: ITMS uses DQS and DQS#.
1: ITMS uses only DQS.
Note: The valid value for DDR is 1.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_PUB_PGSR
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_PUB_PGSR is a PHY general status register.

Member.name: tq
Member.description:
Temperature output (only for LPDDR).
This bit is connected to the DRAM TQ pin that is defined to high when the LPDDR device temperature is greater than or equal to 85?C. Otherwise, this bit is low.

Member.name: dfterr
Member.description:
DQS drift error.
If this bit is set, at least one of the read data strobes has drifted by more than or equal to the drift limit configured in the PHY general configuration register (PGCR).

Member.name: dtierr
Member.description:
Data training intermittent error.
If this bit is set, there is an intermittent error during data training. For example, a pass is followed by a failure and then another pass.

Member.name: dterr
Member.description:
Data training error.
If this bit is set, a valid DQS gating window cannot be found during data training.

Member.name: dtdone
Member.description:
Data training done.
If this bit is set, the PHY has finished data training.

Member.name: didone
Member.description:
DRAM initialization done.
If this bit is set, DRAM initialization is complete.

Member.name: zcdone
Member.description:
Impedance calibration done.
If this bit is set, impedance calibration is complete.

Member.name: dldone
Member.description:
DLL lock done.
If this bit is set, DLL locking is complete.

Member.name: idone
Member.description:
Initialization done.
If this bit is set, DDR system initialization is complete. This bit is set after all the selected initialization routines in PIR register are complete.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_PUB_DLLGCR
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_PUB_DLLGCR is a DLL general control register.

Member.name: dllrsvd2
Member.description:
DLL reserved control.
This bit is connected to the DLL control bus and is reserved for future use.

Member.name: lockdet
Member.description:
Master lock detector enable.
Note: This field is only valid for a few processes and is reserved for other processes.

Member.name: dllrsvd1
Member.description:
DLL reserved control.
This bit is connected to the DLL control bus and is reserved for future use.

Member.name: sbias
Member.description:
Slave bias trim.
This field is used to trim the bias for the slave DLL.
Note: If DWC_DDR3PHY_DLL_TYPEA Verilog macro is defined, the default value for this field is 0x00.

Member.name: mbias
Member.description:
Master bias trim.
This field is used to trim the bias for the master DLL.
Note: If DWC_DDR3PHY_DLL_TYPEA Verilog macro is defined, the default value for this field is 0x00.

Member.name: testsw
Member.description:
Test switch.
This bit is used to select the test signals of either the master DLL ('0') or the slave DLL ('1').

Member.name: atc
Member.description:
Analog test control.
This field is used to select the analog signal to be output on the DLL analog test output (test_out_a) when TESTEN is high (output is Vss when TESTEN is low). The test output either comes from the master DLL or the slave DLL, depending on the setting of the test switch (TESTSW). Both master DLL and slave DLL outputs are similar to analog test signals.
00: filter output (Vc)
01: replica bias output for NMOS (Vbn)
10: replica bias output for PMOS (Vbp)
11: Vdd 00

Member.name: dtc
Member.description:
Digital test control.
This field is used to select the digital signal to be output on the DLL digital test output (test_out_d[1]) when TESTEN is high (output is '0' when TESTEN is low).
The following are valid settings for the master DLL (such as when TESTSW is '0'):
000: 0? output clock (clk_0)
001: 90? output clock (clk_90)
010: 180? output clock (clk_180)
011: 270? output clock (clk_270)
100: 360? internal clock (clk_360_int)
101: speed-up pulse (spdup)
110: slow-down pulse (slwdn)
111: 0? MCTL logic clock (cclk_0)
The following are valid settings for the slave DLL (such as when TESTSW is '1'):
000: input DQS strobe (dqs)
001: input clock reference (clk_90_in)
010: internal feedback clock (clk_0_out)
011: 90? output DQS_b strobe (dqsb_90)
100: 90? output DQS strobe (dqs_90)
101: speed-up pulse (spdup)
110: slow-down pulse (slwdn)
111: auto-lock enable signal

Member.name: testen
Member.description:
Test enable.
This bit is used to enable digital and analog test outputs selected by the DTC and ATC respectively.

Member.name: ipump
Member.description:
Charge pump current trim
This field is used to trim charge pump current.
000: maximum current
111: minimum current

Member.name: dres
Member.description:
Delta resistor trim.
This field is used to trim reference current versus resistor value variation:
00: Rnom
01: Rnom ? 20%
1x: Rnom + 20%
Note: This field is reserved for a few processes and is not used by the DLL.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_PUB_ACDLLCR
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_PUB_ACDLLCR is an AC DLL control register.

Member.name: dlldis
Member.description:
DLL disable.
A disabled DLL is bypassed. The default value 0 indicates that the DLL is enabled.

Member.name: dllsrst
Member.description:
DLL soft reset.
The AC DLL is soft-reset by driving the DLL soft reset pin.

Member.name: sdlbmode
Member.description:
Slave DLL loopback mode.
If this bit is set, the slave DLL is put in loopback mode in which there is no 90? phase shift on read DQS/DQS#. This bit must be set when the byte PHYs are operated in loopback mode such as during BIST loopback.

Member.name: atesten
Member.description:
Analog test enable.
This bit is used to enable the analog test signal to be output on the DLL analog test output (test_out_a). The DLL analog test output is tristated when this bit is 0.

Member.name: sdphase
Member.description:
Slave DLL phase trim.
This field is used to select the phase difference between the input clock and the corresponding output clock of the slave DLL.
0000: 90
0001: 72
0010: 54
0011: 36
0100: 108
0101: 90
0110: 72
0111: 54
1000: 126
1001: 108
1010: 90
1011: 72
1100: 144
1101: 126
1110: 108
1111: 90

Member.name: sstart
Member.description:
Slave auto startup.
This field is used to control how the slave DLL starts up relative to the master DLL locking.
0X: Slave DLL automatically starts up once the master DLL is locked.
10: The automatic startup of the slave DLL is disabled, and the phase detector is disabled.
11: The automatic startup of the slave DLL is disabled, and the phase detector is enabled.

Member.name: mfwdly
Member.description:
Master feed-forward delay trim.
This field is used to trim the delay in the master DLL feed-forward path.
000: minimum delay
111: maximum delay

Member.name: mfbdly
Member.description:
Master feedback delay trim.
This field is used to trim the delay in the master DLL feedback path.
000: minimum delay
111: maximum delay

Member.name: sfwdly
Member.description:
Slave feed-forward delay trim.
This field is used to trim the delay in the slave DLL feed-forward path.
000: minimum delay
111: maximum delay

Member.name: sfbdly
Member.description:
Slave feedback delay trim.
This field is used to trim the delay in the slave DLL feedback path.
000: minimum delay
111: maximum delay

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_PUB_PTR0
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_PUB_PTR0 is PHY timing register 0.

Member.name: titmsrst
Member.description:
ITM soft reset time.
This field defines the number of controller clock cycles during which the ITM soft reset pin must remain asserted when soft reset is performed on ITMs. The number must correspond to a value that is greater than or equal to eight controller clock cycles.
The default value corresponds to eight controller clock cycles.

Member.name: tdlllock
Member.description:
DLL lock time.
The field defines the number of clock cycles for the DLL to stabilize and lock the number of clock cycles from when the DLL reset pin is deasserted to when the DLL has locked and is ready for use. For details, see the PHY data book for the DLL lock time.
The default value corresponds to 5.12 μs at 533 MHz.

Member.name: tdllsrst
Member.description:
DLL soft reset time.
The field defines the number of controller clock cycles during which the DLL soft reset pin must remain asserted when the soft reset is triggered through the PHY initialization register (PIR). The number must correspond to a value that is greater than or equal to 50 ns or eight controller clock cycles, whichever is greater.
The default value corresponds to 50 ns at 533 MHz.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_PUB_PTR1
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_PUB_PTR1 is PHY timing register 1.

Member.name: tdinit1
Member.description:
DRAM initialization time 1. The DRAM initialization time corresponding to the following:
DDR3: CKE high time to first command (tRFC +10 ns or 5 tCK, whichever value is larger)
DDR2: CKE high time to first command (400 ns)
DDR: CKE high time to first command (400 ns or 1 tCK)
LPDDR2: CKE low time with power and clock stable (100 ns)
The default value corresponds to DDR3 360 ns at 533MHz.

Member.name: tdinit0
Member.description:
DRAM initialization time 0. The DRAM initialization time corresponding to the following:
DDR3: CKE low time with power and clock stable (500 μs)
DDR2: CKE low time with power and clock stable (200 μs)
DDR: CKE low time with power and clock stable (200 μs)
LPDDR: CKE high time to first command (200 μs)
LPDDR2: CKE high time to first command (200 μs)
The default value corresponds to DDR3 500 μs at 533MHz.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_PUB_PTR2
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_PUB_PTR2 is PHY timing register 2.

Member.name: tdinit3
Member.description:
DRAM initialization time 3. The DRAM initialization time corresponding to the following:
LPDDR2: time from ZQ initialization command to first command (1 μs)
The default value corresponds to the LPDDR2 1 μs at 533MHz.

Member.name: tdinit2
Member.description:
DRAM initialization time 2. The DRAM initialization time corresponding to the following:
DDR3: reset low time (200 μs on power-on or 100 ns after power-on)
LPDDR2: time from reset command to end of auto initialization (1 μs + 10 μs = 11 μs)
The default value corresponds to DDR3 200 μs at 533MHz.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_PUB_ACIOCR
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_PUB_ACIOCR is an AC I/O configuration register.

Member.name: acsr
Member.description:
Address/Command slew rate.
Note: The Hi3518 does not support the configuration.

Member.name: rstiom
Member.description:
SDRAM reset I/O mode.
This bit is used to select SSTL mode (when set to 0) or CMOS mode (when set to 1) of the I/O for SDRAM reset.

Member.name: rstpdr
Member.description:
SDRAM reset power down receiver.
If this bit is set, the input receiver on the I/O is powered down for the SDRAM RST# pin.

Member.name: rstpdd
Member.description:
SDRAM reset power down driver.
If this bit is set, the output driver on the I/O is powered down for the SDRAM RST# pin.

Member.name: rstodt
Member.description:
SDRAM reset on-die termination.
If this bit is set, the on-die termination on the I/O is enabled for the SDRAM RST# pin.

Member.name: rankpdr
Member.description:
Rank power down receiver.
If this field is set, the input receiver on the I/O is powered down for CKE[3:0], ODT[3:0], and CS#[3:0] pins. RANKPDR[0] controls the power down for CKE[0], ODT[0], and CS#[0]; RANKPDR[1] controls the power down for CKE[1], ODT[1], and CS#[1], and so on.
Note: The actual reset value is calculated based on the configured number of ranks. For the Hi3518, each PUB supports one rank.

Member.name: cspdd
Member.description:
CS# power down driver.
If this field is set, the output driver on the I/O is powered down for CS#[3:0] pins. PDD[0] controls the power down for CS#[0], PDD[1] controls the power down for CS#[1], and so on. The power down for the CKE and ODT drivers is controlled by the DSGCR register.
Note: The actual reset value is calculated based on the configured number of ranks. For the Hi3518, each PUB supports one rank.

Member.name: rankodt
Member.description:
Rank on-die termination.
If this field is set, the on-die termination on the I/O is enabled for CKE[3:0], ODT[3:0], and CS#[3:0] pins. RANKODT[0] controls the on-die termination for CKE[0], ODT[0], and CS#[0]; RANKODT[1] controls the on-die termination for CKE[1], ODT[1], and CS#[1], and so on.
Note: The actual reset value is calculated based on the configured number of ranks. For the Hi3518, each PUB supports one rank.

Member.name: ckpdr
Member.description:
CK power down receiver.
If this field is set, the input receiver on the I/O is powered down for CK[0], CK[1], and CK[2] pins respectively.
Note: The actual reset value is calculated based on the configured number of DDRCKs. For the Hi3518, each PUB supports one DDRCK.

Member.name: ckpdd
Member.description:
CK power down driver.
If this field is set, the output driver on the I/O is powered down for CK[0], CK[1], and CK[2] pins respectively.
Note: The actual reset value is calculated based on the configured number of DDRCKs. For the Hi3518, each PUB supports one DDRCK.

Member.name: ckodt
Member.description:
CK on-die termination.
If this field is set, the on-die termination on the I/O is enabled for CK[0], CK[1], and CK[2] pins respectively.
Note: The actual reset value is calculated based on the configured number of DDRCKs. For the Hi3518, each PUB supports one DDRCK.

Member.name: acpdr
Member.description:
AC power down receiver.
If this bit is set, the input receiver on the I/O is powered down for RAS#, CAS#, WE#, BA[2:0], and A[15:0] pins, as well as the optional DIMM PAR_IN pin and LPDDR TPD pin.

Member.name: acpdd
Member.description:
AC power down driver.
If this bit is set, the output driver on the I/O is powered down for RAS#, CAS#, WE#, BA[2:0], and A[15:0] pins, as well as the optional DIMM PAR_IN pin and LPDDR TPD pin.

Member.name: acodt
Member.description:
Address/Command on-die termination.
If this bit is set, the on-die termination on the I/O is enabled for RAS#, CAS#, WE#, BA[2:0], and A[15:0] pins, as well as the optional DIMM PAR_IN pin and LPDDR TPD pin.

Member.name: acoe
Member.description:
Address/Command output enable.
If this bit is set, the output driver on the I/O is enabled for all address and command pins, as well as the optional DIMM PAR_IN pin and LPDDR TPD pin.

Member.name: aciom
Member.description:
Address/Command I/O mode.
This bit is used to select the SSTL mode (when set to 0) or CMOS mode (when set to 1) of the I/O for all address and command pins, as well as the optional DIMM PAR_IN pin and LPDDR TPD pin.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_PUB_DXCCR
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_PUB_DXCCR is a DATX8 common configuration register.

Member.name: dxsr
Member.description:
Data slew rate (only for D3F I/O).
This field is used to select the slew rate of the I/O for DQ, DM, and DQS/DQS# pins of all DATX8 macros.
Note: The Hi3518 does not support the configuration.

Member.name: dqsnres
Member.description:
DQS# resistor.
This field is used to select the on-die pull-up/pull-down resistor for DQS# pins. This field has the same encoding as DQSRES.
Note: A DQS# resistor must be connected for LPDDR2.

Member.name: dqsres
Member.description:
DQS resistor.
This field is used to select the on-die pull-down/pull-up resistor for DQS pins. DQSRES[3] selects pull-down (when set to 0) or pull-up (when set to 1).
DQSRES[2:0] selects the resistor value as follows:
000: open. The on-die resistor is disconnected.
001: 688 ohms
010: 611 ohms
011: 550 ohms
100: 500 ohms
101: 458 ohms
110: 393 ohms
111: 344 ohms
Note: A DQS resistor must be connected for LPDDR2.

Member.name: dxpdr
Member.description:
Data power down receiver.
If this bit is set, the input receiver on I/O is powered down for DQ, DM, and DQS/DQS# pins of all DATX8 macros. This bit is ORed with the PDR configuration bit of the individual DATX8(DXnGCR).

Member.name: dxpdd
Member.description:
Data power down driver.
If this bit is set, the output driver on I/O is powered down for DQ, DM, and DQS/DQS# pins of all DATX8 macros. This bit is ORed with the PDD configuration bit of the individual DATX8(DXnGCR).

Member.name: dxiom
Member.description:
Data on-die termination.
If this bit is set, the on-die termination on the I/O is enabled for DQ, DM, and DQS/DQS# pins of all DATX8 macros. This bit is ORed with the ODT configuration bit of the individual DATX8 (DXnGCR)

Member.name: dxodt
Member.description:
Data on-die termination.
If this bit is set, the on-die termination on the I/O is enabled for DQ, DM, and DQS/DQS# pins of all DATX8 macros. This bit is ORed with the ODT configuration bit of the individual DATX8 (DXnGCR)

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_PUB_DSGCR
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_PUB_DSGCR is a DDR system general configuration register.

Member.name: ckeoe
Member.description:
SDRAM CKE output enable.
If this bit is set, the output driver on the I/O is enabled for the SDRAM CKE pin.

Member.name: rstoe
Member.description:
SDRAM reset output enable.
If this bit is set, the output driver on the I/O is enabled for the SDRAM RST# pin.

Member.name: odtoe
Member.description:
SDRAM ODT output enable.
If this bit is set, the output driver on the I/O is enabled for the SDRAM ODT pin.

Member.name: ckoe
Member.description:
SDRAM CK output enable.
If this bit is set, the output driver on the I/O is enabled for SDRAM CK/CK# pins.

Member.name: tpdoe
Member.description:
SDRAM TPD output enable (only for LPDDR).
If this bit is set, the output driver on the I/O is enabled for the SDRAM TPD pin.

Member.name: tpdpd
Member.description:
SDRAM TPD power down driver (only for LPDDR).
If this bit is set, the output driver on the I/O is powered down for SDRAM TPD pin. Note that the power down of the receiver on the I/O for SDRAM TPD pin is controlled by ACIOCR[ACPDR] register bit.

Member.name: nl2oe
Member.description:
Non-LPDDR2 output enable.
If this bit is set, the output driver on the I/O is enabled for non-LPDDR2 (ODT, RAS#, CAS#, WE#, and BA) pins. This may be used when a chip designed for both LPDDR2 and other DDR modes is being used in LPDDR2 mode. For these pins, the I/O output enable signal (OE) is an AND of this bit and the respective output enable bit in the ACIOCR or DSGCR register.

Member.name: nl2pd
Member.description:
Non-LPDDR2 power down.
If this bit is set, the output driver and the input receiver on the I/O are powered down for non-LPDDR2 (ODT, RAS#, CAS#, WE#, and BA) pins. This may be used when a chip designed for both LPDDR2 and other DDR modes is being used in LPDDR2 mode. For these pins, the I/O power down signal (PDD or PDR) is an OR of this bit and the respective power-down bit in the ACIOCR register.

Member.name: odtpdd
Member.description:
ODT power down driver.
If this field is set, the output driver on the I/O is powered down for ODT[3:0] pins. ODTPDD[0] controls the power down for ODT[0], ODTPDD[1] controls the power down for ODT[1], and so on.
Note: The actual reset value is calculated based on the configured number of ranks. For the Hi3518, each PUB supports one rank.

Member.name: ckepdd
Member.description:
CKE power down driver.
If this field is set, the output driver on the I/O is powered down for CKE[3:0] pins. CKEPDD[0] controls the power down for CKE[0], CKEPDD[1] controls the power down for CKE[1], and so on.
Note: The actual reset value is calculated based on the configured number of ranks. For the Hi3518, each PUB supports one rank.

Member.name: dqsge
Member.description:
DQS gate early.
This field specifies the number of clock cycles during which the DQS gating must be enabled earlier than its normal position. This field is applicable only when the PDQSR I/O cell and passive DQS gating are used and there is no drift compensation. This field is recommended to be set to zero for all DDR types other than LPDDR2. For LPDDR2, this field is set to (tDQSCKmax ? tDQSCK) divided by clock cycle and rounded up.

Member.name: dqsgx
Member.description:
DQS gate extension.
This field specifies the number of clock cycles during which the DQS gating must be extended beyond the normal burst length width. This field is applicable only when the PDQSR I/O cell and passive DQS gating are used and there is no drift compensation. This field is recommended to be set to zero for all DDR types other than LPDDR2. For LPDDR2, this field is set to (tDQSCKmax ? tDQSCK) divided by clock cycle and rounded up.

Member.name: lpdllpd
Member.description:
Low-power DLL power down.
If this bit is set, the PHY must respond to the DFI low-power opportunity request and power down the DLL of the byte when the wakeup time request satisfies the DLL lock time.

Member.name: lpiopd
Member.description:
Low-power I/O power down.
If this bit is set, it specifies that the PHY should respond to the DFI low-power opportunity request and power down the I/Os of the byte.

Member.name: zuen
Member.description:
Impedance update enable.
If this bit is set, the PHY must perform impedance calibration (update) whenever there is a controller initiated DFI update request. Otherwise the PHY will ignore an update request from the controller.

Member.name: bdisen
Member.description:
Byte disable enable.
If this bit is set, the PHY must respond to the DFI byte disable request. Otherwise the byte disable from the DFI is ignored, and therefore bytes can be disabled only by using the DXnGCR register.

Member.name: puren
Member.description:
PHY update request enable.
If this bit is set, the PHY must issue a PHY-initiated DFI update request when there is DQS drift of more than 3/4 of a clock cycle within one continuous (back-to-back) read burst. The PHY issues PHY-initiated update requests and the controller must respond by default. Otherwise, the PHY may return erroneous values. The option to disable it is provided only for silicon evaluation and testing.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_PUB_DCR
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_PUB_DCR is a DRAM configuration register.

Member.name: tpd
Member.description:
Test power down (only for LPDDR).
Note: The Hi3518 does not support this function.

Member.name: rdimm
Member.description:
Registered DIMM.
Note: The Hi3518 does not support this function.

Member.name: udimm
Member.description:
Unbuffered DIMM address mirroring.
Note: The Hi3518 does not support this function.

Member.name: ddr2t
Member.description:
DDR 2T timing.
Note: The Hi3518 does not support this function.

Member.name: nosra
Member.description:
No simultaneous rank access.
Note: The Hi3518 does not support this function.

Member.name: ddrtype
Member.description:
DDR type.
This field is used to select the DDR type for the specified DDR mode. The following are valid values for LPDDR2:
00: LPDDR2-S4
01: LPDDR2-S2
10: LPDDR2-NVM
11: reserved
Note: You do not need to configure this field.

Member.name: mprdq
Member.description:
Multi-purpose register (MPR) DQ (only for DDR3).
This field specifies the value that is driven on non-primary DQ pins during MPR reads.
0: The primary DQ drives out the data from MPR (0-1-0-1); non-primary DQs drive '0'.
1: The primary DQ and non-primary DQs all drive the same data from MPR (0-1-0-1).

Member.name: pdq
Member.description:
Primary DQ (only for DDR3).
This field specifies the DQ pin in a byte that is designated as a primary pin for multi-purpose register (MPR) reads. The valid values 0?7 correspond to DQ[0] to DQ[7] respectively.

Member.name: ddr8bnk
Member.description:
DDR 8-bank.
If this bit is set, the SDRAM used has eight banks. For tRPA, tRP+1 and tFAW are used for 8-bank DRAMs; for other tRPA, tRP but no tFAW is used. Note that a setting of 1 for DRAMs that have less than 8 banks still results in correct functionality but less tighter DRAM command spacing for the parameters described here.

Member.name: ddrmd
Member.description:
SDRAM DDR mode.
000: LPDDR (mobile DDR)
001: DDR
010: DDR2
011: DDR3
100: LPDDR2 (mobile DDR2)
101–111: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_PUB_DTPR0
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_PUB_DTPR0 is DRAM timing parameters register 0.

Member.name: tccd
Member.description:
Read to read and write to write command delay.
0: BL/2 for DDR2 and 4 for DDR3
1: BL/2 + 1 for DDR2 and 5 for DDR3

Member.name: trc
Member.description: Activate to activate command delay (same bank). The valid value ranges from 2 to 42.

Member.name: trrd
Member.description: Activate to activate command delay (different banks). The valid value ranges from 1 to 8.

Member.name: tras
Member.description: Activate to precharge command delay. The valid value ranges from 2 to 31.

Member.name: trcd
Member.description: Activate to read or write delay. The minimum time from when an activate command is issued to when a read or write to the activated row can be issued. The valid value range from 2 to 11.

Member.name: trp
Member.description:
Precharge command period.
This field indicates the minimum time between a precharge command and any other command. Note that the controller automatically derives tRPA for 8-bank DDR2 devices by adding 1 to tRP. The valid value ranges from 2 to 11.

Member.name: twtr
Member.description: Internal write to read command delay. The valid value ranges from 1 to 6.

Member.name: trtp
Member.description: Internal read to precharge command delay. The valid value ranges from 2 to 6. Note that even though RTP does not apply to JEDEC DDR devices, this parameter must still be set to a minimum value of 2 for DDR because the controller always uses the following DDR2 equation to calculate the read to precharge timing (which is BL/2 for JEDEC DDR): AL + BL/2 + max(RTP, 2) – 2

Member.name: tmrd
Member.description:
Load mode cycle time.
This field indicates the minimum time between a load mode register command and any other command. For DDR3, this field indicates the minimum time between two load mode register commands. The valid value for DDR2 ranges from 2 to 3. For DDR3, the value used for tMRD is 4 plus the value programmed in these bits.
00: 4
01: 5
10: 6
11: 7

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_PUB_DTPR1
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_PUB_DTPR1 is DRAM timing parameters register 1.

Member.name: tdqsckmax
Member.description: Maximum DQS output access time from CK/CK# (LPDDR2 only). This value is used for implementing read-to-write spacing. The valid value ranges from 1 to 7.

Member.name: tdqsck
Member.description:
DQS output access time from CK/CK# (only for LPDDR2).
This value is used for calculating the read latency. The valid value ranges from 1 to 7. This value is derived from the corresponding parameter in the SDRAM data sheet divided by the clock cycle time without rounding up. The fractional remainder is automatically adjusted for by data training in quarter clock cycle units. If data training is not performed, this fractional remainder must be converted into quarter clock cycle units and the gating registers (DXnDQSTR) are adjusted accordingly.

Member.name: trfc
Member.description:
Refresh-to-refresh.
This field indicates the minimum time between two refresh commands or between a refresh and an active command. The value unit is clock cycle. The value is derived from the minimum refresh interval from the data sheet, tRFC(min), divided by the clock cycle time. The default number of clock cycles is the greatest value in tRFC(min) defined in the JEDEC protocol.

Member.name: trtodt
Member.description:
Read to ODT delay (only for DDR3).
This field specifies whether ODT can be enabled immediately after the read postamble or one clock delay has been added.
0: ODT may be turned on immediately after read postamble.
1: ODT may not be turned on until one clock after the read postamble.
If tRTODT is set to 1 and ODT is enabled, the read-to-write latency increases by 1.

Member.name: tmod
Member.description:
Load mode update delay (only for DDR3).
This field indicates the minimum time between a load mode register command and a non-load mode register command.
00: 12
01: 13
10: 14
11: 15

Member.name: tfaw
Member.description:
4-bank activate period.
No more than 4-bank activate commands may be issued in a specified tFAW period. This field applies only to 8-bank devices. The valid value ranges from 2 to 31.

Member.name: trtw
Member.description:
Read to write command delay.
0: standard bus turn around delay
1: add 1 clock to standard bus turn around delay
This parameter allows the user to increase the delay between issuing write commands to the SDRAM when preceded by read commands. This provides an option to increase bus turn-around margin for high-frequency systems.

Member.name: taondtaofd
Member.description:
ODT turn-on/turn-off delays (only for DDR2). The delay unit is clock cycle.
00: 2/2.5
01: 3/3.5
10: 4/4.5
11: 5/5.5
Most DDR2 devices use the fixed value 2/2.5. For non-standard SDRAMs, the user must ensure that the operational write latency is always greater than or equal to the ODT turn-on delay. For example, if the CAS latency, CAS additive latency, and write latency for a DDR2 SDRAM is 3, 0, and 2 respectively, the 2/2.5 but not 3/3.5 or larger can be used.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_PUB_DTPR2
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_PUB_DTPR2 is DRAM timing parameters register 2.

Member.name: tdllk
Member.description: DLL locking time. The valid value ranges from 2 to 1023.

Member.name: tcke
Member.description:
CKE minimum pulse width.
This field also specifies the minimum time during which the SDRAM must remain in power-down or self-refresh mode. For DDR3, this parameter must be set to the value of tCKESR that is usually greater than the value of tCKE. The valid value ranges from 2 to 15.

Member.name: txp
Member.description:
Power down exit delay.
This field indicates the minimum time between a power down exit command and any other command. This parameter must be set to the maximum value among the various minimum power down exit delay parameters specified in the SDRAM data sheet, for example, max(tXP, tXARD, tXARDS) for DDR2 and max(tXP, tXPDLL) for DDR3. The valid value ranges from 2 to 31.

Member.name: txs
Member.description:
Self refresh exit delay.
This field indicates the minimum time between a self refresh exit command and any other command. This parameter must be set to the maximum value among the various minimum self refresh exit delay parameters specified in the SDRAM data sheet, for example, max(tXSNR, tXSRD) for DDR2 and max(tXS, tXSDLL) for DDR3. The valid value ranges from 2 to 1023.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_PUB_MR0
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_PUB_MR0 is mode register 0.

Member.name: mr0
Member.description:
SDRAM mode register 0 (MR0).
This field corresponds to valid bits 13?0 of mode register 0 (MR0) in the DDRn SDRAM user manual. DDRC_PUB_MR0 bit[15:14] must be set to 0b00.
Note: For details about MR0, see the DDRn SDRAM user manual.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_PUB_MR1
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_PUB_MR1 is mode register 1.

Member.name: mr1
Member.description:
SDRAM extended mode register 1 (EMR1).
This field corresponds to valid bits 13?0 of mode register 1 (MR1) in the DDRn SDRAM user manual. DDRC_PUB_MR1 bit[15:14] must be set to 0b00.
Note: For details about MR1, see the DDRn SDRAM user manual.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_PUB_MR2
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_PUB_MR2 is mode register 2.

Member.name: mr2
Member.description:
This field corresponds to valid bits 13?0 of mode register 2 (MR2) in the DDRn SDRAM user manual. DDRC_PUB_MR2 bit[15:14] must be set to 0b00.
Note: For details about MR2, see the DDRn SDRAM user manual.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_PUB_MR3
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_PUB_MR3 is mode register 3.

Member.name: mr3
Member.description:
SDRAM extended mode register 3 (EMR3)
This field corresponds to valid bits 13?0 of mode register 1 (MR1) in the DDRn SDRAM user manual. DDRC_PUB_MR3 bit[15:14] must be set to 0b00.
Note: For details about MR3, see the DDRn SDRAM user manual.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_PUB_ODTCR
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_PUB_ODTCR is an ODT configuration register.

Member.name: wrodt3
Member.description:
Write ODT: rank select. The description is the same as wodt0.
Note: The actual reset value is calculated based on the configured number of ranks. The Hi3518 does not support the configuration.

Member.name: wrodt2
Member.description:
Write ODT: rank select. The description is the same as wodt0.
Note: The actual reset value is calculated based on the configured number of ranks. The Hi3518 does not support the configuration.

Member.name: wrodt1
Member.description: Write ODT: rank select. The description is the same as wodt0.

Member.name: wrodt0
